message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) because it deals with improving the performance of neural network decoders for tasks like machine translation. The paper proposes a new method for trainable greedy decoding that uses a small neural network actor to manipulate the hidden state of a previously-trained decoder. This method is inspired by earlier work on reinforcement learning for beam search, but does not require reinforcement learning and can be trained reliably on a range of models. 

The paper also involves machine learning techniques, which suggests that it could also belong to the arXiv CS sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the use of neural networks in the proposed method could also make it relevant to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the experiments conducted in the paper involve parallel corpora and architectures, which could make it relevant to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition).
